post_text:
Today is World Suicide Prevention Day. If you or someone you know is struggling with depression and/or thoughts of suicide, please reach out for help! You are not alone. You MATTER. You are LOVED.

Please call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255.

Our Mental Health Services and Supports Team is also available to help you: www.greeleyschools.org/mentalhealthservices

post_text:
Not feeling super? Stay home!

COVID-19 spreads rapidly. If your child has a fever, cough, loss of taste or smell OR shortness of breath, they must stay home! Symptoms of COVID-19 also include a sore throat, runny nose or congestion, muscle or body aches, headache, fatigue, nausea or vomiting and diarrhea. If your child is experiencing any of these symptoms, PLEASE KEEP THEM HOME!

Join The Success Foundation's Junior Board! Applications for their Junior Board are due on September 23rd. Students on their Junior Board will have opportunities to participate in mock interviews, writing resumes and cover letters, and public speaking, and will enjoy various guest speakers on topics such as financial management, goal setting and time management, and networking. Students will also be given resources related to leadership enrichment.

Visit https://www.d6successfoundation.org/student-r‚Ä¶/junior-board/ to apply!

post_text:
Help give our new school a name!

You are invited to submit your suggestions for naming the new preschool-eighth grade school that will be constructed in West Greeley and open in Fall of 2022. The new school will be located near Boomerang Golf Course off 71st Avenue, between 4th and 10th Street. This is the first new school to be constructed in Greeley-Evans School District 6 - that isn‚Äôt replacing an existing school - since 2003, and the first time additional classrooms have been added to the district in 20 years. #ImDistrict6 #WeAreDistrict6

Join the Virtual Bilingual College and Resource Fair on September 12, 2020 from 10:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. Learn about higher education options, how to finance the costs of higher education and local scholarship opportunities. There will also be information about English classes and GED options and resources for students that are undocumented or have DACA. Representatives from Aims Community College, Centennial BOCES, Front Range Community College, GEAR Up, Greeley-Evans School District 6, TRIO, and The University of New Mexico will be available to answer your questions. #ImDistrict6 #WeAreDistrict6

post_text:
Join the Virtual Bilingual College and Resource Fair on September 12, 2020 from 10:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. Learn about higher education options, how to finance the costs of higher education and local scholarship opportunities. There will also be information about English classes and GED options and resources for students that are undocumented or have DACA. Representatives from Aims Community College, Centennial BOCES, Front Range Community College, GEAR Up, Greeley-Evans School District 6, TRIO, and The University of New Mexico will be available to answer your questions.

This event is FREE for students of all ages and their parents and guardians. Please register for this event prior to the event date, and join at least 10 minutes before the event start time. The event will begin at 10:00 a.m. sharp.

#ImDistrict6 #WeAreDistrict6

post_text:
The Greeley-Evans School District 6 Board of Education is hosting a work session and business meeting at 4 p.m. Monday, August 24, 2020.

This meeting will be conducted in person. Seating is limited and will be provided on a first-come first serve basis. Overflow viewing of the live-streamed meeting will also be available but space is also limited. This meeting will be livestreamed on the Greeley-Schools YouTube page. Go to www.greeleyschools.org for a link to the live stream.

Members of the public shall be allowed to submit requests to address the Board. Requests to speak should be submitted through the District 6 Public Participation form no later than noon on the day of the meeting. Here is the link to the Public Participation form: https://forms.gle/36pqqApCfzLNVPgx7. Those addressing an item on the Board agenda will have time to speak at the beginning of the business meeting. Those addressing items not on the agenda will have time so speak at the end of the business meeting. Each speaker is asked to limit comments to 2 minutes.
shared_text:
DOCS.GOOGLE.COM
Public Participation

post_text: Awesome job to our 2020 UCHealth - Healthy Kids Club 5210+ winners! Many of our schools earned top ranks and earned money that will go towards wellness! T-Shirts are being delivered to all of our district schools! Congrats!
shared_text:
Greeley-Evans District 6 Student Wellness
August 18 at 5:12 PM ¬∑

Congratulations to our 2020 5210+ winners! The 5210+ challenge took place in February 2020 and 100 schools from 10 northern Colorado school districts participated, representing 28,194 students, staff and families. T-shirts are being delivered to all of the participating schools as we speak!

Many of our schools earned top ranks and money for wellness. Nice work and thank you so much UCHealth - Healthy Kids Club!!

Top Large Schools
Prairie Heights Middle School $1,250
Centennial Elementary School $500
Heiman Elementary $250
Meeker Elementary School $250
S Christa McAuliffe STEM Academy $250

Top Small Schools
Shawsheen Elementary School $1,500
The Fred Tjardes School of Innovation $250

Top Staff Participation
Prairie Heights Middle School $400
Meeker Elementary School $300

post_text: Welcome back District 6! We are thrilled to have you back for the 2020-2021 school year! If this year's journey begins within one of our school campuses or if it is through remote learning, we are excited to continue to engage, inspire, and making this school year THE BEST! Although it might look a bit different, we hope through safe learning we are able to continue to make you proud! We wish you the best for a successful and rewarding school year! #ImDistrict6 #WeAreDistrict6 #1stDayOfSchool

post_text:
The first day of school is on Monday! If you haven't registered for the 2020-2021 school year, make sure to do so ASAP!

Due to health and safety precautions, registration for the 2020-2021 school year will be completed online. For students in grades K-5, this process will replace the in-person registration days from previous years. Students in grades 6-12, once completing these online tasks, will be invited to a brief in-person registration day event. Prior to the first day of school on August 17th, all of the tasks listed in the link below must be completed in order to ensure our schools have accurate and current information for your student(s). #ImDistrict6

www.greeleyschools.org/FallRegistration

post_text:
The online application for Free & Reduced meals is now active!

Please complete an application for Free & Reduced Meals by visiting: www.greeleyschools.org/applyformeals

If you received a letter from our office dated July 1st, or after, you do not need to complete the application.

We strongly encourage all families to apply, even if you believe you may not qualify.

If you have any questions, feel free to reach us at schoolfood@greeleyschools.org or by phone at 970-348-6600.

post_text:
The Greeley-Evans School District 6 Board of Education is hosting a work session and business meeting at 4 p.m. Monday, August 10, 2020.

This meeting will be conducted in person. Seating is limited and will be provided on a first-come first serve basis. Overflow viewing of the live-streamed meeting will also be available but space is also limited. This meeting will be livestreamed on the Greeley-Schools YouTube page. Go to www.greeleyschools.org for a link to the live stream.

Members of the public shall be allowed to submit requests to address the Board. Requests to speak should be submitted through the District 6 Public Participation form no later than noon on the day of the meeting. Here is the link to the Public Participation form: https://forms.gle/36pqqApCfzLNVPgx7. Those addressing an item on the Board agenda will have time to speak at the beginning of the business meeting. Those addressing items not on the agenda will have time so speak at the end of the business meeting. Each speaker is asked to limit comments to 2 minutes.

GREELEYSCHOOLS.ORG
Greeley-Evans School District 6 / Homepage

Be a superhero! Wear your mask! The first day of school is August 17, 18 and 19 for grades K-8 and the week of August 17 for high school students, depending on your school and schedule. Students returning to school in the Fall are required to wear masks to school and during much of the school day. post_text: Join us for the Drive Thru Backpack Giveaway on Wednesday, August 5, from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. at Island Grove Regional Park. These backpacks will be given out to only District 6 students. Please write the name of your student or students, his or her school, and their student ID number on a sheet of paper and put that in the window of your vehicle as you enter the park. Entrance to the event is ONLY through 14th Avenue. Please do not line up early for this event. Greeley-Evans District 6 Nutrition Services will also be on hand to give out food bags to District 6 families. There are different backpacks for elementary and secondary students. One backpack per child! We look forward to seeing you August 5!
text: Join us for the Drive Thru Backpack Giveaway on Wednesday, August 5, from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. at Island Grove Regional Park. These backpacks will be given out to only District 6 students. Please write the name of your student or students, his or her school, and their student ID number on a sheet of paper and put that in the window of your vehicle as you enter the park. Entrance to the event is ONLY through 14th Avenue. Please do not line up early for this event. Greeley-Evans District 6 Nutrition Services will also be on hand to give out food bags to District 6 families. There are different backpacks for elementary and secondary students. One backpack per child! We look forward to seeing you August 5!

post_text:
The first day of school is in 2 weeks! Students returning to in-person learning in the Fall are required to wear masks to school and during much of the school day. Here are some tips on how to keep your cloth face mask clean:

1. You can wash your face mask in the washing machine with your regular laundry.
2. Use laundry detergent and the warmest appropriate water setting for the cloth used to make the face mask.
3. Wash by hand. Use a bleach solution - 5 tablespoons (1/3rd cup) household bleach per gallon of room temperature water. Make sure the bleach is intended for disinfection. Soak the face mask in the bleach solution for 5 minutes, and rinse thoroughly with cool water.
4. Dry your face mask in the dryer on the highest heat setting or air dry the mask by laying it on a flat surface. If possible, dry your face mask in the sun!

The first day of school is August 17, 18 and 19 for grades K-8 and the week of August 17 for high school students, depending on your school and schedule.

#ImDistrict6

post_text:
Students returning to school in the Fall are required to wear masks to school and during much of the school day. Make sure to wear your face mask correctly:

1. Wash your hands before putting on your face mask.
2. Put the face mask over your nose and mouth and secure it under your chin.
3. Try to fit it snugly against the sides of your face.
4. Don't put the face mask around your neck or up on your forehead.
5. Don't touch the face mask. If you do, wash your hands or use handsanitizer to disinfect.

The first day of school is August 17, 18 and 19 for grades K-8 and the week of August 17 for high school students, depending on your school and schedule. Register for in-person or remote learning by visiting our website: www.greeleyschools.org/FallRegistration
Registration for Remote Learning must be completed by July 31st, 2020.

#ImDistrict6

Students returning to school in the Fall are required to wear face masks to school and during much of the school day. Wearing a face mask that covers your nose and mouth helps protect others in case you're infected with COVID-19 but don't have symptoms. Wear a face mask in public and around people who don't live in your household, especially when you are unable to stay six feet apart.

The first day of school is August 17, 18 and 19 for grades K-8 and the week of August 17 for high school students, depending on your school and schedule. Register for in-person or remote learning by visiting our website: www.greeleyschools.org/FallRegistration
Registration for Remote Learning must be completed by July 31st, 2020.

We are grateful to have such strong community partners to help us enter into the new school year. #WeAreDistrict6 #District6Strong

The 2020 Census is still happening and everyone living in America needs to be counted, but time is running out. You can still respond easily online, by phone, or by mail. Respond now before a Census Taker may need to visit your home later this summer.
Online: www.2020census.gov
Phone: 844-330-2020 (English)
Our communities and our schools will miss out on funding every year for the next 10 years if you don‚Äôt respond to the 2020 Census. Please, fill out your Census today!
Your responses to the 2020 Census are strictly confidential and protected by law.

Sponsors Needed! Due to the outbreak of COVID-19 and health concerns regarding large gatherings, the annual School Kickoff Community Celebration scheduled for August 8, 2020 at Island Grove Regional Park is cancelled.

Free backpacks and school supplies will still be distributed through schools this year for students in need. Sponsors who have remained committed to this event and backpack distribution will pay for the backpacks, school supplies, and shipping and distribution costs.

We still need additional sponsors who can help purchase as many backpacks and school supplies as possible to support our students. For more information on how to become a sponsor, please click on the link below. #ImDistrict6

https://www.greeleyschools.org/Page/15778

Don't forget to join us at The Burroughs Variety Show Telethon on Facebook Live this Wednesday, July 1st at 7pm! This musical extravaganza benefits D6 music students.

shared_text:
The Burroughs is with Briana Harris and 10 others.

We've just dropped the full lineup for The Burroughs Variety Show Telethon! This show will be loaded with the talents of over 10 Northern Colorado performers, and will also feature several very special Burroughs solo and side projects. PLUS, we'll be hosted through the whole show by the one and only Margot Chobanian of 105.5 The Colorado Sound!

Save the date to tune in on July 1 at 7pm, and remember that 100% of proceeds and donations will benefit The Success Foundation serving Greeley-Evans Schools, helping music teachers and students in our district! #coloradomusic #sweatysoulmusic #virtualshow #nocomusic

post_text:
The Greeley-Evans School District 6 Board of Education will be conducting a virtual meeting at 4 p.m. on June 22, 2020. This meeting will be conducted entirely via videoconferencing. To ensure transparency of the Board‚Äôs proceedings, members of the public who want to view the live feed of the meeting can view it on the Greeley Schools YouTube page or can attend by phone or online via Zoom. To attend, register at https://greeleyschools.org.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_F7vVm8UHREa3-b74jIu3SA. A video recording of the meeting will remain available on the Greeley Schools YouTube page after the live meeting concludes.

Members of the public shall be allowed to submit requests to address the Board. Requests to speak should be submitted through the District 6 Public Participation form (https://forms.gle/QNiHxQPTC9ZopAE59) no later than noon today. The final determination as to whether an item will appear on the board agenda will be at the discretion of the superintendent and board president.

post_text:
Closing the Gap: Building Bridges Between Youth and the Capitol

Youth (ages 10-24) are encouraged to register and participate in the Virtual Youth Town Hall hosted by the Colorado Youth Advisory Council (COYAC) in partnership with Student Voice Student Vote and upRISE on Saturday, June 27th from 12-2pm.

Young people have valuable perspectives that need to be heard by elected officials to shape policies that impact their future.

Registration is required (see link below or in the attached flyer). Registration closes soon.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdKSW3Ni2N2Q0uWsvAVHgaCMjzvr9Lr6LlBimIUbAX5gWjm0g/viewform

A live host will guide viewers through the journey to raise funds on-air to benefit District 6 music students!

The Bohemian Foundation and The Success Foundation for grant support
Philip Van Drunen for production assistance
Shawn Williams for graphic design

post_text: Starting today, our Greeley-Evans District 6 Nutrition Services will begin distributing FREE lunch & SUPPER meals for any child 18 and under! Please check out the updated routes and times to take advantage of these awesome summer meals for the kiddos!
shared_text:
Greeley-Evans District 6 Nutrition Services is sharing a COVID-19 Update.
June 9 at 1:18 PM ¬∑

Starting today, we will begin distributing FREE lunch & SUPPER meals for any child 18 and under!

Our meal sacks will now contain 4 lunches and 4 suppers. Replacing breakfast meals with supper meals allows us to provide more sustenance and hearty nutrition to our children.

Route information is current at the time of this post but is subject to change at any time.
Please visit www.greeleyschools.org/kidseatfree for the most current route information.

post_text:
Construction will begin this summer on the new Greeley West High School. Preliminary site and school design was completed in May. A Design Advisory Group composed of teachers, administrators and students at the school provided recommendations and feedback to architects. Most of the existing school will remain in place during construction, and there will be little disruption to learning as the new school is built.

Click on the link below to view the conceptual flyover video of the new GWHS! #ImDistrict6

https://www.greeleyschools.org//site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=9405&ModuleInstanceID=36978&ViewID=6446EE88-D30C-497E-9316-3F8874B3E108&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=42350&PageID=23823

post_text:
The Burroughs are hosting a variety show telethon benefiting District 6 music students! We appreciate this incredible band's support of our music programs!

Please check out the details provided by The Burroughs below:
"The Burroughs Variety Show Telethon
An Online Experience benefitting Greeley-Evans School District 6
With special guests
July 1, 7pm - Facebook Live

Come one, come all to a virtual extravaganza celebrating music, community, and connection! The Burroughs are curating a live variety show lineup designed to make you laugh, dance, and hug your housemates closer.

Musical selections from the full band will be mixed with never-before-seen side projects from our band members, as well as performances from a lineup of stellar special guests.

A live host will guide viewers through the journey as we work to raise funds on-air to benefit District 6 music students!

Stay tuned for more details, and see you online!

Special thanks to:
The Bohemian Foundation for grant support
Philip Van Drunen for production assistance
Shawn Williams for graphic design"

post_text:
Do you know a student or student group who has demonstrated an outstanding commitment to the promotion of philanthropy and volunteerism through his/her work in the community? Whether it has been recently because of the COVID-19 public health issue, or any time in a student's life, now is the time to nominate them for the Colorado National Philanthropy awards campaign. There is no cost to be nominated and the Outstanding Youth and Youth Group each receive a $3,000 award sponsored by the Daniels Fund.

Nominations are due June 15, 2020 by 5 pm MST.
All nominations must be complete when submitted.

https://www.greeleyschools.org//site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=4&ModuleInstanceID=92&ViewID=6446EE88-D30C-497E-9316-3F8874B3E108&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=42305&PageID=1

post_text:
Greeley-Evans District 6 Nutrition Services is offering a federally-funded Summer Food Service Program for children. Lunch & Breakfast will be served to any child between the age of 1 and 18 years old free of charge All Summer Long! With new waivers from the government, we will continue to operate the model we used during the COVID-19 school building closures. Click on the link below for more information about routes!

While this school year may not have ended how we all would have liked or hoped for, we are truly proud of all of the hard work our students, families, teachers, principals, nutrition workers, transportation workers, custodial staff, IT department, health clerks and nurses, and all support staff have done to ensure that our students were successful during this time of Remote Learning. Thank you for supporting us and for learning with us during these uncertain times.

We hope you all have a safe, incredible summer, D6! #WeAreDistrict6

post_text:
As always, we celebrate our School Heath Clerks that work extensively for our students and play a vital role in making sure they are safe, healthy, and ready to learn. With over 74,000 total health office visits throughout a school year we rely heavily on their knowledge, dedication, and commitment to make sure our students are well taken care of.

Although School Health Clerk day was a few days back, we celebrate our 38 health clerks that take care of our 23,000 students when school is in and out of session. We appreciate and THANK YOU!

post_text:
Happy School Nurse Day! School Registered Nurses play an integral role in the health of school communities, regardless of whether they're in school or not. Our teams promote health and support education teams by ensuring that students are safe, healthy & ready to learn.

We have 14 School Registered Nurses caring for 23,000 students. One Lead School Registered Nurse who coordinates 14 School Registered Nurses, 38 Health Clerks, 10 Health Clerk Subs, and 20 screening team members!

Share your favorite school nurse stories in the comments below!
text:
Happy School Nurse Day! School Registered Nurses play an integral role in the health of school communities, regardless of whether they're in school or not. Our teams promote health and support education teams by ensuring that students are safe, healthy & ready to learn.

We have 14 School Registered Nurses caring for 23,000 students. One Lead School Registered Nurse who coordinates 14 School Registered Nurses, 38 Health Clerks, 10 Health Clerk Subs, and 20 screening team members!

Share your favorite school nurse stories in the comments below!

post_text: STORIES OF SUCCESS: REMOTE LEARNING EDITION - At Chappelow K-8, Gifted and Talented Parent Lead Hilary Mathews took on the unique challenge of leading the Young Chautauqua program virtually this year. The theme is Breaking Barriers...how appropriate! After COVID-19 led to the cancellation of in-person classes, Hilary immediately set up weekly virtual meetings with the students and continued to coach them with help from Tanis Bator. Twenty-five Chappelow scholars researched, wrote and memorized monologues in order to portray prominent historical figures. These phenomenal students are so inspiring! In order of appearance: Alice Paul, Carrie Fisher, Harriet Tubman, Hedy Lamarr, John Colter, J.R.R. Tolkien, Jules Verne, Margaret Brown, Marie Taglioni, Martha Graham, Martin Luther, Mary Jackson, Natalie Wood, Nikola Tesla, Ritchie Valens, Shirley Temple and Walt Disney. Share your remote learning stories and photos by emailing school-communityrelations@greeleyschools.org and we will feature your story on this page. #D6RemoteLearning #ImDistrict6

post_text:
In case you missed it, all Class of 2020 graduations have been RESCHEDULED: https://bit.ly/35rDnMm

Graduates from the Class of 2020 will be honored in new ways this year. Friday, students picked up yard signs honoring the Class of 2020. Banners will be hung over 8th Avenue and over 10th Street later this month, sponsored by the The Success Foundation. And a special video will be developed for each high school honoring graduates and the Class of 2020.

All ceremonies will be held at District 6 Stadium and will begin at 8 a.m.

Here is a schedule for the planned graduation ceremonies:
‚Ä¢ Tuesday, July 28: Early College Academy
‚Ä¢ Wednesday, July 29: Jefferson High School
‚Ä¢ Thursday, July 30: Northridge High School
‚Ä¢ Friday, July 31: Greeley Central High School
‚Ä¢ Saturday, August 1: Greeley West High School
‚Ä¢ Saturday, August 29: Greeley-Evans Alternative Program/Greeley NEXT

We ‚ù§Ô∏è you, Class of 2020!! #ImDistrict6

Due to the outbreak of COVID-19 and State of Colorado Safer at Home order, District 6 has made the decision to postpone graduations in the hope that some of the restrictions on gatherings will have lifted by late July to allow in-person ceremonies. District 6 will continue working with the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment and the Weld County Department of Public Health and Environment on guidelines and protocols for these planned ceremonies.

Please click on the link for each high school's graduation date and time.

STORIES OF SUCCESS: REMOTE LEARNING EDITION -
Sarah Yauchzee's children, who all attend Chappelow Arts Magnet K-8, have had great support during this unexpected transition. Yauchzee has been working full-time from home and helping her kids manage their schoolwork.

"I am extremely thankful for our teachers, who provide clear lessons and who are available just one conference call away," she said. "Thank you!!"

Share your remote learning stories and photos by emailing school-communityrelations@greeleyschools.org and we will feature your story on this page. #D6RemoteLearning #ImDistrict6

We give them an A+ for effort and active participation! post_text:
STORIES OF SUCCESS: REMOTE LEARNING EDITION - Ann Campbell's second grade classroom at Chappelow K-8 is usually full of insects after spring break. But this year, she won't get to teach one of her favorite science units in the same way. A friend of hers suggested she combine remote reading and science lessons to teach her students about insects. She emailed parents asking them to encourage her students to make the butterfly life cycle using found objects at home. A student named Priscila made the life cycle using pasta, an orange peel, and rice. Ms. Campbell loves seeing her students use their creative juices to make learning fun even though they can't be at school! Share your remote learning stories and photos by emailing school-communityrelations@greeleyschools.org and we will feature your story on this page.
#ImDistrict6 #D6RemoteLearning

Mr. Reliford teaches at Jackson Elementary School and Mrs. Reliford teaches at Madison Elementary School They have two young boys at home, and have been trying to get creative about teaching their combined 800 students during this time of remote learning. So, they have created home activity videos they are sharing on YouTube and Schoology. The activities focus on fitness, skills, math and reading concepts that can be done with little or not equipment. It's important for all kids to stay active during this time of remote learing! post_text:
STORIES OF SUCCESS: THE REMOTE LEARNING EDITION
Michelle Green-Lockard has figured out the success for her children's remote learning is in having a schedule every day. Michelle has a kindergarten student and a fifth grader at Centennial Elementary School. Here is how they structure their days!
We start our day at 7:15 a.m. with breakfast. Then it is:
> 45 minutes of math
> 15 minutes brain break
> 45 minutes of I-reading
> 15 minutes brain break
> 30 minutes of home economics
> 15 minutes of physical activity
> 30 minutes of drama
> 30 minutes of computer activities
> Conferences
> 30 minutes of activities chosen by kids
> Lunch
> Movie time
We want to hear your stories of success with remote learning! Send your stories, tips, ideas and photos to school-communityrelations@greeleyschools.org! Let's show our communities we are District 6! #ImDistrict6

post_text:
Please share this information!

"United Way of Weld County encourages people to look into whether or not they qualify for the Colorado Department of Human Service‚Äôs Low-Income Energy Assistance Program (LEAP).

Due to the impacts of coronavirus (COVID-19), the application deadline for the LEAP has been extended through Aug. 31, 2020, or when funds are exhausted. The LEAP season was supposed to end on April 30.

‚ÄúWe recognize there is a real need for the families and individuals in our state at this time,‚Äù said LEAP manager Theresa Kullen. ‚ÄúWe are extending the deadline to submit applications so we can help as many people as possible. Applications will be processed as long as we have funding available.‚Äù

Applications can be accessed through LEAP‚Äôs website at www.colorado.gov/cdhs/leap, which also links to the state‚Äôs Colorado PEAK system for online applications, or call 1-866-HEAT-HELP (1-866-432-8435). To date, LEAP has helped more than 66,500 households with an average benefit of $372."

post_text: Tonight is Friday night, a night when our high school athletes typically face off against their rival, from across town or across the state. But this isn't a typical Friday night. To honor our student athletes and to honor our amazing Class of 2020, we turned on the lights at D6 Stadium for 20 minutes. We know during these challenging times that it's important to remember who we are and how tough we can be. We love you Class of 2020 and all our District 6 students. We light the night for you. #ImDistrict6 #WeAreDistrict6 #Classof2020 #LighttheNight

Attention ALL BENEFITED D6 EMPLOYEES - It's Open Enrollment Time! Including all retiring and non-renewed employees, MUST open enroll in order to obtain, continue, or waive benefits that begin July 1 for the 2020-2021 plan year. All employee participants must open enroll through Infinite Visions (www.greeleyschools.org/infinitevisions) by April 17, 2020.

Virtual benefit enrollment call-in meetings have been set up for additional information, help or questions. Individuals can also make individualized appointments for help from a representative from District 6 or Flood & Peterson. Please see the attached flyer for times and information.

post_text:
Today is U.S. Census Day! Right now is a great time to complete the U.S. Census if you haven't done so already.

The goal of the 2020 Census is to count everyone once, only once, and in the right place. The Census Bureau will continue to improve its use of mobile technology, geospatial innovations, and internet self-response.

For schools, the U.S. Census helps determine how much federal income comes into your school district every year in the form of nutrition disbursements, special education funding from IDEA, and Title 1 funding.

For more information, please click on the link below!

https://www.greeleyschools.org/Page/23888

post_text: Gov. Jared Polis issued an executive Stay At Home order today, meaning all residents must stay inside their home unless they are getting essential services, exercising or accessing medical services. District 6 food distribution is considered an essential service and will continue. To see this week's distribution sites, visit www.greeleyschools.org. We urge all our families and employees to abide by this order and stay home! It is the only way to halt the spread of COVID-19. Please, do not go out unless you absolutely must. If you go out to exercise, stay at least six feet from all people who do not live in your home. This is very serious! Please do everything you can to stop COVID-19 from spreading! #dotherightthingco #ImDistrict6

post_text:
Many, many thanks to Greeley-Evans District 6 Nutrition Services and D6 staff for distributing meals, Chromebooks, and medications to families and students today. Your health and safety are our number one priority. Prior to handing out meals, employees had their temperatures taken and sanitized their hands. #ImDistrict6

Keep in mind: Due to the unexpected high volume of participants at all our food distribution sites, only one meal per student will be distributed today. We are very sorry for the inconvenience, but we beg you to be patient with us. This is new territory for all of us. Our Nutrition Services Department is working very hard to make adjustments and have more food available tomorrow.

post_text: District 6 Families: If you do not have a wifi connection in your home, please contact Comcast immediately. They are offering free wifi hotspots and reduced fees for services in your home. Digital Learning begins for all students March 31. Get signed up today for service! https://corporate.comcast.com/covid-19

On Monday, March 23 from 10:30 am - 12:30 pm, Greeley-Evans School District 6 health office staff will be at all non-charter schools to return medications to families, including contracted preschool sites such as ABC. East.

Medications and supplies may only be picked up from your child‚Äôs school during this window of time. Please remain in your vehicle and write your child‚Äôs name and grade on a piece of paper in large letters so it can be seen through the car window from at least six feet away.

Be prepared to show identification. Health office staff will retrieve medications and document the pick-up. When school resumes, parents will be notified to bring necessary medications back to school.

If you are unable to pick up medication and supplies on March 23, please arrange to send someone in your place.

https://www.greeleyschools.org//site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=4&ModuleInstanceID=37578&ViewID=6446EE88-D30C-497E-9316-3F8874B3E108&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=40963&PageID=1

For schools, the U.S. Census helps determine how much federal income comes into your school district every year in the form of nutrition disbursements, special education funding from IDEA, and Title 1 funding.

UPDATE: Please visit https://clever.com/in/wcsd6 for login options. If you are still having problems with username and/or passwords please email SISHelpdesk@greeleyschools.org for assistance.

Having problems signing into the extended learning platforms on the Chromebook you were issued over the break? Please remember that the user name will most likely be the first initial and last name of your child. (@greeleyschools dot org does not have to be used) The password will be their student ID number. (most likely your child will also know this number as their lunch ID number - which is the same!)

Thank you for a very successful deployment of Chromebooks to help extend learning over break for our students! Thank you to staff for sacrificing spring break to help get these much-needed resources out!

post_text:
Everyone Counts: The U.S. Census is coming soon! The goal of the 2020 Census is to count everyone once, only once, and in the right place. And it is very important that everyone participate!

For schools, the U.S. Census helps determine how much federal income comes to our school district every year in the form of nutrition disbursements, special education funding from IDEA and Title 1 funding.

Between 2011 and 2018, Colorado school districts received $3.56 billion. That is why District 6 is participating with our community partners in promoting the census. Census forms are available in 13 different languages. All households will be receiving information in the mail from the Census Bureau in March.

For more information, please click on the link below!

https://www.greeleyschools.org/Page/23888

Greeley-Evans School District 6 Parents, Guardians, Students, Teachers and Staff:

We are aware of a fake page posing as us. The page is using our logo without permission, and shares posts containing misinformation and expletives. We have reported this page to Facebook numerous times, and are working diligently to have the page removed.

Our page "Greeley-Evans School District 6" @GreeleyEvansSchools is the only authorized Facebook page for Greeley-Evans School District 6.

Please reach out to us with any questions or concerns.

Our friends at Envision CoOrg are hosting the 7th Annual 5K In My Shoes walk, run or roll race on Sunday, April 26th! Many of our schools participate as teams each year to benefit such a valuable community resource + help promote awareness of children and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities or delays within the community.

There will be informational booths, Envision Art Program art for sale, lots of music and energy, as well as fun activities for kids!

Register for only $27 as a District 6 community member with code: D64ENVISION - See you out there!

post_text:
Tomorrow is the fifth annual District 6 & Friends Art Walk! Check out all of the art from 5-8pm!

This spectacular event will show case artwork created by hundreds of students attending District 6 and Charter Schools from Kindergarten through 12th grade and over 50 creative teachers, dance, music and art! Come celebrate this one of a kind "First Friday" event by experiencing the exhibits at nearly 30 different downtown Greeley locations featuring 30 area schools including charter schools as well as artwork from UNC art students. Be sure to stop by and see the K-12 Spectrum themed show at the Academy of Natural Therapy, located at 625 8th Avenue. Students have creatively interpreted this theme in 2D and 3D works of art. #ImDistrict6

post_text:
Happy National School Breakfast Week! Every day, Greeley-Evans District 6 Nutrition Services works hard to make sure that our students have well-balanced, nutritious, delicious starts to their school day!

According to the School Nutrition Association, children who eat school breakfast are more likely to:
Reach higher levels of achievement in reading and math.
Score higher on standardized tests.
Have better concentration and memory.
Be more alert and maintain a healthy weight.

#ImDistrict6

According to the School Nutrition Association, children who eat school breakfast are more likely to:

Have better concentration and memory.
Be more alert and maintain a healthy weight.

#ImDistrict6

post_text: Tonight is the first meeting of the Design Advisory Group for the McAuliffe STEM Academy renovation project, funded through the 2019 bond issue. This group of McAuliffe staff, parents, students and District 6 administrators will advise the design of the significant addition to McAuliffe. The project will include additional classrooms, a new gym, expanded cafeteria, a safe and secure entry, and improvements to the traffic flow and parking at the school. This is an exciting project! Thank you voters of Greeley and Evans!! #ImDistrict6 #GrowingGreatSchools #BuildingSchoolsBuildingCommunities

post_text:
Make sure to check out the fifth annual District 6 & Friends Art Walk on March 6th from 5-8pm!

This spectacular event will show case artwork created by hundreds of students attending District 6 and Charter Schools from Kindergarten through 12th grade and over 50 creative teachers, dance, music and art! Come celebrate this one of a kind "First Friday" event by experiencing the exhibits at nearly 30 different downtown Greeley locations featuring 30 area schools including charter schools as well as artwork from UNC art students. Be sure to stop by and see the K-12 Spectrum themed show at the Academy of Natural Therapy, located at 625 8th Avenue. Students have creatively interpreted this theme in 2D and 3D works of art. #ImDistrict6

The Greeley Dream Team
February 25 at 5:04 PM ¬∑

Last night, we celebrated 17 students who received the 2020 Dream Team Honors Scholarship and presented them before the Greeley-Evans School District 6 Board of Education! We are incredibly grateful to collaborate with Greeley-Evans School District 6, and we are immensely grateful to Delia & John W. Haefeli and the Bond family for providing some additional scholarships for our students this year. Rodrigo (6th picture) received the Delia and John W. Haefeli Scholarship. Angel and Genesis (7th picture) received the Bond Family Summit Award in addition to the Dream Team Honors Scholarship. Congratulations to all our recipients!

#iamthegreeleydreamteam

Today is the last day to apply for the Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee! The Citizens‚Äô Bond Oversight Committee will help monitor expenditures and projects associated with the bond issue approved by voters in November 2019.

The purpose of the committee is to provide a high level of accountability and communication on behalf of the Board of Education to the citizens of Greeley-Evans School District 6.

To apply for membership on the Citizens‚Äô Bond Oversight Committee, click on this link, https://forms.gle/DojbSGJ7iiAG8XfG7, or visit the front desk at the District 6 Administration Building, 1025 9th Avenue in Greeley to obtain a printed application. All applications must be submitted by 4 p.m. Friday, February 21 either electronically or in person to the Office of the Superintendent, District 6 Administration Building, 1025 9th Avenue, Greeley, CO 80631. #ImDistrict6

post_text:
Students from Heath Middle School were able to visit Banner Health today for the ‚ÄúGet into the Guts of Healthcare‚Äù event hosted by the Northern Colorado Health Sector Partnership and NCMC. Over 25 seventh grade students were able to experience a wide variety of careers in the healthcare industry and ask questions pertaining to many medical fields. Our Panther students visited the radiology department, emergency department and peri-op services.

Thank you to Banner Health - NCMC for being such a strong community partner and collaborating with District 6 on many upcoming projects including paid summer internships, apprenticeships, and job shadowing opportunities. These valuable on-site experiences are preparing our future medical leaders for the workforce.

post_text: There is police activity in the 2800 block of Aspen Avenue in East Greeley. The area has been cordoned off by Greeley Police and no one is being let in and out of the area at this time. Students who live in that neighborhood are being kept safe at their home school. Parents can pick up their student at the school. This is affecting about 30 students, mostly who attend Bella Romero Academy, Greeley West High School and Salida del Sol Charter. Call the office of your school if you have any questions. Thank you!

Congratulations to the Northridge High School JROTC Rifle Team for placing 6th at the Marines Service Championships in Selma, Alabama! Their 6th place finish has earned them a ticket to the National competition in Ohio from March 19th - 21st.

We are extremely proud of the supportive parents, dedicated students, and Master Gunnery Sergeant Brian Yarolem who have worked diligently to get to Nationals and represent District 6. #ImDistrict6

(Photos from Spring 2019 and Fall 2019)

post_text:
Last week, our Greeley-Evans District 6 Worksite Wellness program held a fun cooking class, led by our state-award winning Northridge High School Prostart program! The class was offered free to all District 6 staff and families. Healthy, heart shaped pizzas were created and baked for Valentine's Day weekend as well as a knife safety presentation.

Just one of many career pathways offered to students, the Northridge ProStart program has grown in popularity. Students enrolled in ProStart have the opportunity to earn concurrent enrollment credit from Metropolitan State University, participate in paid internships and compete in culinary competitions for scholarships. Great job Northridge culinary students and ProStart facilitator, Joanna Fedor!
text:

Just one of many career pathways offered to students, the Northridge ProStart program has grown in popularity. Students enrolled in ProStart have the opportunity to earn concurrent enrollment credit from Metropolitan State University, participate in paid internships and compete in culinary competitions for scholarships. Great job Northridge culinary students and ProStart facilitator, Joanna Fedor!

post_text:
The U.S. Census is coming soon! Every 10 years, the U.S. Constitution mandates that everyone living in the United States be counted as part of the Census, and 2020 is a Census year.

The goal of the 2020 Census is to count everyone once, only once, and in the right place. And, it is very important that everyone participate!

For schools, the U.S. Census helps determine how much federal income coes to our school district every year in the form of nutrition disbursements, special education funding from IDEA and Title 1 funding.

For more information, please click on the link below! #ImDistrict6

https://www.greeleyschools.org/Page/23888

GREELEYSCHOOLS.ORG

post_text: More than 100 District 6 staff, students and community partners joined together Wednesday to begin to define the vision the school district will pursue to reach its goals over the next decade. It's was the beginning of developing a new strategic plan for District 6. Thanks to all who gave up their entire day to help us help our students! #ImDistrict6 #Innovation2020

post_text:
In 2017, voters in Greeley and Evans approved a Mill Levy Override for Greeley-Evans School District 6. It was the first time voters had made this local investment in our schools. We want to sincerely thank you. Your dollars are making a huge difference in our schools. New text books, computers, digital content, security cameras, secure locks and badge system, new secure visitor and volunteer system, wage increases for support staff, after school programs, summer school intervention and enrichment programs, critical repairs and more. Take a look at the difference this investment has made in our schools. #ImDistrict6 #GrowingGreatSchools #2017MillLevyOverride
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aIKMW7E8ezw&feature=youtu.be&fbclid=IwAR117KCo1xwtIVzvxAo9M4htcZ6sAZxs7ijNhDyjucscsFHa_70Y9AYlglg

This camp is for ages 8-10. Read the flyer below for more information.

post_text: Members of the Board of Education visited Greeley West High School this afternoon, observing classes and meeting with staff. Over the past three days, this school has experienced a flood in its gym and a power outage. Needless to say, staff and students are excited for a new school! Thank you, voters of Greeley and Evans. Plans are well underway to give the Spartans a home they deserve! #ImDistrict6 #GreeleyWest #SpartanPride

post_text:
Our Greeley Evans District 6 Family Center welcomed guests from the Colorado Department of Education yesterday to discuss the 21st Century Community Learning Centers (CCLC) grants that are provided to many of our schools. These grants offer our district (and many other Greeley-Evans community based non profits) a wide variety of academic opportunities that include services, programs, and activities for our students during non-school hours.

Our district was selected and recognized by the state to host the question/answer collaboration session to further discuss how these grants continue to benefit student success and raise district graduation rates. Thank you to all that attended and contributed!

Greeley-Evans School District 6 is seeking residents of the school district to serve on a Citizens‚Äô Bond Oversight Committee that will help monitor expenditures and projects associated with the bond issue approved by voters in November 2019.

The purpose of the committee is to provide a high level of accountability and communication on behalf of the Board of Education to the citizens of Greeley-Evans School District 6.

To apply for membership on the Citizens‚Äô Bond Oversight Committee, click on this link, https://forms.gle/DojbSGJ7iiAG8XfG7, or visit the front desk at the District 6 Administration Building, 1025 9th Avenue in Greeley to obtain a printed application. All applications must be submitted by 4 p.m. Friday, February 21 either electronically or in person to the Office of the Superintendent, District 6 Administration Building, 1025 9th Avenue, Greeley, CO 80631.

post_text:
Greeley-Evans School District 6 is offering residents a chance to see first-hand what is happening in its schools with a VIP Tour on Thursday, February 13 from 8 a.m. -1 p.m.

This half-day tour will provide information on the operations of the school district, including academic programs, instructional practices, assessments, district finances and much more. Participants will visit and tour three schools, as well as the Central Kitchen and Warehouse. Lunch will be provided, and participants will be transported via school bus to the different sites.

The tour will begin at the District 6 Administration Building, 1025 9th Avenue in Greeley.

Participants will visit one elementary school, a K-8 or middle school and a high school. There will also be time for discussion and questions on the ride between locations.

The District 6 VIP Tours are free. Space is limited. To sign up for a tour, visit www.greeleyschools.org/VIPtour. If you need assistance signing up, please contact Theresa Myers at tmyers@greeleyschools.org or at (970) 348-6003.

post_text:
Aims Community College is offering free tax preparation and e-filing through the Tax Help Colorado program, funded by the Denver-based Piton Foundation. Anyone who earned less than $56,000 last year can stop by the Greeley, Fort Lupton or Loveland campuses on the dates and times listed below:

‚Ä¢ Greeley Campus: Saturdays, February 1 ‚Äì April 11 from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. in the Westview Building (closed March 14 and 21)
‚Ä¢ Fort Lupton Campus: February 14 ‚Äì March 6 from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.
‚Ä¢ Loveland Campus: February 6 ‚Äì 27 from 4 to 8 p.m.

Aims students who help with the program take a two-credit course that covers basic law and tax preparation in the Fall semester. Students then take an IRS VITA Certification Exam once they‚Äôve completed the course, which certifies them to prepare tax returns for low to middle-income taxpayers.

For more information visit https://taxhelpco.org or call 211.

post_text:
Greeley-Evans School District 6 has launched a new website to provide information about the projects funded through the 2019 bond issue.

The site can be reached through the District 6 website at www.greeleyschools.org/bond.

This dedicated website will track all the projects funded through the voter-approved bond issue. It provides information on renovations and building projects at each school site. It also includes general information about the bond issue, including financial transparency, frequently asked questions, bids and contractors selected for projects, news and updates, and will eventually include reports from the Bond Oversight Committee.
#ImDistrict6

https://www.greeleyschools.org/Page/23823

post_text:
Graduation rates for Colorado school districts were released by the Colorado Department of Education today, and for the second year in a row, Greeley-Evans School District 6 has exceeded the state average for the number of students graduating within four years of starting high school. #ImDistrict6

https://www.greeleyschools.org//site/default.aspx?PageType=3&DomainID=4&ModuleInstanceID=92&ViewID=6446EE88-D30C-497E-9316-3F8874B3E108&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=40084&PageID=1
